column4: Is there a command line command I can run to see if there are updates for my system?  Maybe it is 'apt-get --simulate update', but that seems to take a little long.
sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get upgrade
dsmask is an option you can set in /etc/fstab to determine the permissions of directories that are mounted

is (hd0, 1) in grub, is that /dev/hda1 or /dev/hda2?
in grub 0=1 so hda0 would be same as hda1 depending on wher eyou look but the 0 is used for grub and most of linux
